item.title: Building waste dumped in park, 23rd October
item.description:
Pile of building waste has been dumped in Holly Oak Park Wood in the last day or two. Looks like someoneâ€™s old bathroom suite. Perpetrator has clearly opened the gate at the Days Lane entrance and driven a truck across the grass. Concerned that with current high winds the pile will be spread across the park (and into the river) unless dealt with promptly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oaklands Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping rubbish on their property front garden, 23rd October
item.description:
The council's role is to investigate the crime, and if they can identify the perpetrator, they can take legal action against them. The landowner is responsible for clearing the waste, but the council will and can investigate incidents of illegal dumping and may prosecute the offenders. You have made no attempt to do this whatsoever and could not be even remotely bothered, closing the case within hours of it being opened. If the council can identify the individual responsible, they have the authority to issue fines or take court action against the owners of a property regardless of being private. If every house or property knew the council would not take action against this kind of antisocial behaviour, then everyone will start doing it. Maybe the local media needs to make residents aware they can just DUMP AWAY . This will now be reported this to the local council's environmental health team, as this is a form of anti-social behaviour or fly-tipping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Anne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
